results.title: Paris: living space
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Cities”.
A fascinating documentary that looks at the development and expansion of Paris. The film looks at the growth of the city in organised patterns and it also looks at the various people, throughout history, who influenced the design of Paris.

results.title: Paris: la belle epoque
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: An excursion through Paris, starting at the present day and then going through the period from the 1880’s to 1914. Consists of a montage of paintings by contemporary artists, such as Toulouse-Lautrec, Monet and Picasso, photographs, engravings and posters, together with some archive film, accompanied by the music of Debussy, Satie, Chambrier, Stravinsky, and a variety of contemporary quotes and observations.

results.title: Parents who work
results.creator_credit: Ted Emery, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: Thomas has a sore throat but is sent to school due to his parents’ commitments at the office. Should Dad or Mum have stayed at home? This program looks at parenting and dual responsibility, the importance of forward planning employers’ attitudes to women with families, how and why employers should help and how to negotiate with a partner.

results.title: Parents are people too
results.brief_description: Discusses adolescent feelings of resentment against authority and emphasises the role of the parent, the teacher, and the adolescent himself in resolving differences. Shows how family discussions can replace arguments and help establish good family relations.

results.title: Parenting: stress and the child
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Looks at some potentially stressful family situations for the child, such as the arrival of a baby, entry into a new school, and puberty. Indicates that, although stress is inevitable in children’s lives, once the causes are realised by parents, it can be utilised as a stepping stone towards emotional growth and family unity.

results.title: Parental behaviour of fish
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Houben, Michael Sullivan and University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Shows patterns of breeding and parental care in ciclid fish and encourages the use of aquaria in animal behaviour studies in schools. The first part compares the behaviour of two central American species; the second part presents the strikingly different parental care of an African ciclid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cheryl Houben, Michael Sullivan and University of Melbourne
results.description: Shows patterns of breeding and parental care in ciclid fish and encourages the use of aquaria in animal behaviour studies in schools.
